title: Public transport for the Rugby Union International Test Series: Second Series – Wallabies v Wales Saturday 13th July 2024
articleContent:
Public transport is your best way to enjoy the Wallabies taking on the Wales for the International Test Series. Extra services will help you get to and from the AAMI Park on Saturday 13 July.

The event will begin at 7:45pm.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

 Metropolitan train

Return service from Richmond Station

  • Glen Waverley – leaving at 10pm and 10:10pm from Platform 10
  • Ringwood – leaving at 10pm and 10:10pm from Platform 9
  • Frankston – leaving at 10:11pm from Platform 4
  • Cheltenham - leaving at 10:20 pm from Platform 4
  • Sandringham – leaving at 10:14pm from Platform 2
  • Westall - leaving at 10pm and 10:22pm from Platform 6

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from AAMI Park

Route 70

  • Trams will operate from Flinders Street / Elizabeth Street (Stop 4) and Stop 7C MCG/John Cain Arena.

 Metropolitan bus

Customers can catch the following buses close to the MCG:

Route 246

Please note, services may terminate prior to the end of the match.

 Regional train

  • Normal services departing from Southern Cross Station
